text:
Ingo Wald presented our short paper
			[*RTX Beyond Ray Tracing: Exploring the Use of Hardware Ray Tracing Cores for Tet-Mesh Point Location*](/publications/rtx-points)
			at HPG 2019 in Strasbourg.

I presented our paper [*Scalable Ray Tracing Using the Distributed FrameBuffer*](/publications/dfb),
			and Mengjiao Han presented our paper [*Ray Tracing Generalized Tube Primitives: Method and Applications*](/publications/tubes)
			at EuroVis 2019 in Porto.
The pre-print of our short paper accepted to HPG 2019 is now available online.
The pre-prints of our two papers accepted to EuroVis 2019 are now available online.
Our paper [*CPU Isosurface Ray Tracing of Adaptive Mesh Refinement Data*](/publications/amr-iso) has been published in [IEEE TVCG](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8493612).

I presented our paper [*libIS: A Lightweight Library for Flexible In
			Transit Visualization*](/publications/libis-isav18) at [ISAV 2018](http://vis.lbl.gov/events/ISAV2018/) in Dallas.
Feng Wang presented our paper [*CPU Isosurface Ray Tracing of Adaptive Mesh Refinement Data*](/publications/amr-iso) at [IEEE VIS 2018](http://ieeevis.org/year/2018/welcome) in Berlin.
I'll be presenting part of the [Topology Toolkit Tutorial at IEEE VIS](https://topology-tool-kit.github.io/ieeeVisTutorial.html) in Berlin.

Our paper
		[*libIS: A Lightweight Library for Flexible In Transit Visualization*](/publications/libis-isav18)
		was accepted to [ISAV 2018](http://vis.lbl.gov/events/ISAV2018/)!

Our paper
		[*CPU Isosurface Ray Tracing of Adaptive Mesh Refinement Data*](/publications/amr-iso)
			was accepted to [IEEE VIS 2018](http://ieeevis.org/year/2018/welcome)!

Chuck Hansen presented our paper
		[*VisIt-OSPRay: Toward an Exascale Volume Visualization System*](/publications/visit-ospray)
			at [EGPGV18](http://egpgv.org/) in Brno.

Sidharth Kumar presented our paper
		[*Scalable Data Management of the Uintah Simulation Framework for
			Next-Generation Engineering Problems with Radiation*](/publications/scasia18)
			at [SC Asia 2018](https://www.sc-asia.org/) in Singapore.

I'm visiting [Argonne National Laboratory](https://www.alcf.anl.gov/)
		for the next two weeks to work with Silvio Rizzi and Joe Insley on our interactive
		in situ visualization project.

Our paper [*A Virtual Reality Visualization Tool for Neuron Tracing*](/publications/vrnt)
		has been published in [IEEE TVCG](http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8017617/).

Carson Brownlee presented our paper on
		[*CPU Volume Rendering of Adaptive Mesh Refinement Data*](/publications/cvamr) at the
		[SIGGRAPH Asia 2017 Symposium on Visualization](https://sa2017.siggraph.org/submitters/symposium-on-visualization) in Bangkok.

An article covering our virtual reality tool for neuron tracing appeared
		in [Scientific American](https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/technology-from-harry-potter-movies-brings-magic-of-brain-into-focus/).

Pavol Klacansky and I presented a poster on our [virtual reality visualization tool for neuron tracing](/publications/vrnt)
		at the 2017 [Society of Neuroscience annual meeting](https://www.sfn.org/annual-meeting/neuroscience-2017)
		in Washington D.C.

I gave a lightning talk about our work on *Flexible In Situ Visualization of LAMMPS Simulations* at
		[ISAV17](http://vis.lbl.gov/Events/ISAV-2017/) in Denver.

I presented our hands-on tutorial *Using OSPRay with Data-Distributed Applications*
		at the 2017 Intel HPC Developer Conference in Denver. A PDF of the [slides is available online](https://software.intel.com/sites/default/files/managed/a0/70/In-Situ-Software-Defined-Visualization-Hands-on-Lab-with-a-Talk-on-Using-OSPRay.pdf).


		Silvio Rizzi presented our work on *Interactive In Situ Visualization
			of LAMMPS Simulations with OSPRay* at the 2017 Intel HPC Developer Conference in Denver.
			A [recording of the talk](https://software.intel.com/en-us/events/hpc-devcon/2017/parallel-programming?multiplayer=5714674720001)
			and [slides](https://software.intel.com/sites/default/files/managed/a8/3e/133416-Interactive-In-Situ-Visualization-of-LAMMPS-Simulations-with-OSPRay.zip) are available online.

I presented our paper [*A Virtual Reality Visualization Tool for Neuron Tracing*](/publications/vrnt)
		at [IEEE VIS17](http://ieeevis.org/year/2017/welcome) in Phoenix.

I presented the CPU-based rendering section of the [*Interactive Visualization
		of Large Dynamic Particle Data*](http://ieeevis.org/year/2017/info/tutorials#Interactive_Particle_Vis)
		tutorial with Martin Falk, Michael Krone and Guido Reina
		at [IEEE VIS17](http://ieeevis.org/year/2017/welcome) in Phoenix.
I presented our paper [*Progressive CPU Volume Rendering with Sample Accumulation*](/publications/savr) at [EGPGV 2017](http://egpgv.visus.uni-stuttgart.de/egpgv2017/) in Barcelona.

I'm returning for an internship at Intel in Austin with the
		[OSPRay](http://www.ospray.org/) team.

I'm starting my summer internship at Intel in Austin, where I'll be working with the
		[OSPRay](http://www.ospray.org/) team.
Our paper [*In Situ Exploration of Particle Simulations with CPU Ray Tracing*](/publications/isp-jsfi) has been published in Supercomputing Frontiers and Innovations.

I presented our work on [*In Situ Exploration of Particle
		Simulations with CPU Ray Tracing*](/publications/isp-jsfi) at the
		[ISC Workshop on In Situ Visualization](http://woiv.org/2016/index.html) in Frankfurt.
Our paper [*VTK-m: Accelerating the Visualization Toolkit for Massively Threaded Architectures*](/publications/vtkm) has been published in IEEE Computer Graphics & Applications.

Ingo Wald presented our paper
		[*CPU Ray Tracing Large Particle Data with Balanced P-k-d Trees*](/publications/pkd) at
		[IEEE VIS15](http://ieeevis.org/year/2015/info/vis-welcome/welcome) in Chicago.

I'm starting my summer internship at [Los Alamos National Lab](http://www.lanl.gov/) as
		part of the [Data Science at Scale School](http://datascience.dsscale.org/school/). I'll be working
		with Chris Sewell on the [VTK-m](https://gitlab.kitware.com/vtk/vtk-m) project.
I'm starting my PhD in Computer Science at the University of Utah!
